channel.title: Requesting a small change
channel.description:
I saw some posts of people saying that they do not go on RuneScape and on this website at the same time, well here is a solution to that because they are right.
If we're so protective of SCAR that we have to change its title so that RuneScape wouldn't know, then why aren't we as protective as we can be by changing the website title too.
Why not change the title to... Windows Media Player, Notepad, or something silly like online games online games come here! and get rid of the topic title... in the website title.
You see things so detectable like a title saying... Moparisthebest - jagex knows is the creator of moparscape [RS2][SRL] PowerMinerSD by Surajd [ ~ ] - this one erm very easy lol. Sorry for using Surajd as an example but I just picked something random.
So can you please change the title. :) It would be great.
Maybe make a javascript array with 10 or 20 different titles and have the web browser find a random one each time. :)

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:10, topic:5417”][quote author=Ron link=topic=7159.msg89939#msg89939 date=1153888783]
I see. Why did everyone spend time making the disguiseScar function and other functions like that then? :eek: Seems like a waste of time I guess.
[/quote]

well, SCAR is used for other games, depending on how those games are made its possible they could see window titles, I know blizzard does it with warden[/quote]
wow is that how they know if u are maphacking and stuff?

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

moparisthebest:

You guys dont understand, there is absolutly no way runescape can detect any other windows or webpages you have open or are connected to, its 100% impossible to do from thier end.

I was thinking the same…
But they can see referring url ofcourse buy I wouldn’t be worried about playing same time and reading Mopar forums, actually im doing it now

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

maybe we can have a little checkbox at the top saying: hide title, which would change the title using JS

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:3, topic:5417”]Simple:

For SCAR:

procedure DisguiseScar(disguise: String); begin GetApplication.Title:= disguise; GetSelf.Caption:= disguise; end;

Plus, they can’t prove that you cheat just because you went on a cheat related website. Although it is probable cause…[/quote]
The only problem is that RuneScape is a dictatorship and they can do whatever the fuck they want lol. One of my friends got banned for autoing, and he never even autoed, it was a perm ban too. So I wouldn’t be so trusting bebemycat2.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @Spike Spike
item.description:
@Spike wrote:

I think this is a really good idea, But… I dont really care if jagex bans me. I dont hack on runescape … whats the point. I like private servers

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mmmk:

It will still show the reffering url wont it?

not unless you click a link like http://www.runescape.com

and the client cannot detect anything about your operating sytem at all, thats the benefits to the client running in a sandbox

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting a small change
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Simple:

For SCAR:

procedure DisguiseScar(disguise: String); begin GetApplication.Title:= disguise; GetSelf.Caption:= disguise; end;

Plus, they can’t prove that you cheat just because you went on a cheat related website. Although it is probable cause…

Read full topic
